Animals¶

Animals Module

class animals.Animals(age=0, weight=None)[source]¶

Superclass for Herbivores and Carnivores.

Class constructor for Animals. Creates an animal with age, weight and fitness as attributes.

Parameters

  • age (int) – Age of the animal. Default value is 0

  • weight (float) – Weight of the animal. If no value is specified, the weight assigned is calculated in class method ‘calculate_weight’.

adjust_weight_after_birth(self, new_born_animal)[source]¶

Updates the weight of the mother after a baby is born.

Parameters

new_born_animal (Class object) – New born baby

aging(self)[source]¶

Increases the age of the animal by one year and updates its fitness.

calculate_fitness(self)[source]¶

Calculates the fitness of an animal.

Returns

Fitness of the animal

Return type

float

calculate_weight(self)[source]¶

Calculates the weight of animals. This is used whenever the class initializer for the animals did not receive any specified weight input.

Weight is drawn from a normal distribution.

Returns

Weight of the animal.

Return type

float

check_move(self)[source]¶

Checks if an animal moves. This is checked every time an animal attempts to migrate.

Returns

‘True’ if the check is passed, ‘False’ otherwise.

Return type

bool

death(self)[source]¶

Determine whether an animal dies. The animal dies if the fitness of the animal is 0. The animal also has a fixed probability of dying each year.

Returns

‘True’ is the animal dies and ‘False’ otherwise.

Return type

Bool

gives_birth(self, n)[source]¶

Animals have a chance to produce an offspring each year. This is decided by their weight and the amount of nearby same species animals.

Gender plays no role in mating, and each animal can only give birth to one offspring each year at most.

After a successful birth, the animal loses weight equal to a portion of the birth weight of the baby.

Parameters

n (int) – Number of same species animals in the same cell.

Returns

  • bool

  • True if a newborn is successfully born.

  • new_born_animal (class object) – Newborn animal.

loss_of_weight(self)[source]¶

Calculates the amount of weight an animal loses every year, and updates the animals weight and fitness.

migrate(self, relative_fodder_list)[source]¶

Animal attempts to migrate to one of the nearby cells. The movement is determined by the fitness of the animal and the fodder in the nearby cells.

The animal migrates only once per year, and the animal moved status is updated to ‘has_moved’ after it has attempted to migrate.

Parameters

relative_fodder_list (List) – A list of up to four nearby available cells. The list can contain any cells with invalid landscape types. (i.e. landscape that cannot be traversed such as mountain or ocean).

Returns

chosen_cell – The cell the animal choose to migrate to.

Return type

Cell object

probability_birth(self, n)[source]¶

Calculates the probability of birth.

Parameters

n (int) – Nearby same species animals

Returns

Probability of birth

Return type

float

update_fitness(self)[source]¶

Updates the fitness of an animal.

classmethod weight_check_for_pregnancy()[source]¶

Checks whether the animal’s weight is above a threshold. This is required for the animal to potentially get pregnant.

Returns

Threshold value for pregnancy.

Return type

float

weight_gain(self, eaten)[source]¶

Weight update after feeding. Currently used for herbivore feeding and carnivore killing.

Parameters

eaten (float) – Amount of relative fodder eaten.

Returns

Weight adjustment.

Return type

float

chance_of_kill(self, prey)[source]¶

The chance the carnivore has to kill its prey.

Parameters

prey (Class object) – The animal the carnivore is trying to kill.

Returns

Probability of killing prey.

Return type

float

fitness_greater_than_prey(self, prey)[source]¶

Checks if carnivore’s fitness is greater than the herbivore’s fitness, and not greater than a threshold.

Parameters

prey (Class object) – The animal the carnivore is trying to kill.

Returns

‘True’ if the carnivore’s fitness is greater than the herbivore’s, and not greater than ‘DeltaPhiMax’ threshold. ‘False’ otherwise.

Return type

bool

kill(self, nearby_herbivores)[source]¶

Carnivore attempts to kill a nearby herbivore. If the carnivore successfully kills the nearby herbivore, the carnivore’s weight is updated and its fitness is re-evaluated.

The carnivore continues to kill nearby herbivores until it is full or there are no more nearby herbivores.

Parameters

nearby_herbivores (list) – List of herbivores residing in same cell as the carnivore.

Returns

killed_herbivore – List containing all herbivore objects that was killed by the carnivore.

Return type

list

feed(self, cell_fodder_info)[source]¶

Herbivore feeding. Each year, the herbivore attempts to eat an amount of fodder. How much the herbivore actually eats depends on the available fodder in the cell.

Parameters

cell_fodder_info (float) – Amount of available fodder in the cell.

Returns

eaten – Amount of actually eaten fodder.

Return type

float
